name: Omni Shoreham Hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a great holiday in D.C. and we stayed at this top hotel.While we agree with a previous reviewer that there were lots of conferences going on we did not find them obtrusive as the hotel is big enough to accommodate everybody in comfort.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a lovely sylvan setting.
Excellent Conference Hotel
reviews.text: I enrolled as a Select Guest(free) before we went there and we got a voucher for an upgrade.Membership also provided a complimentary beverage and newspaper plus evening turndown if requested.

reviews.title: Nice hotel the Omni
reviews.text: The lobby of this hotel is gorgeous and the floral arrangements of fresh flowers were a joy to see and smell!Staff were helpful and mostly pleasant.One concierge was a bit grumpy but others were charming.

Our room was spacious and the bathroom was large and in good order.One small quibble however-there was no safety bar in the bathtub and it could be difficult for someone elderly or infirm to get out of the tub safely.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for a relaxing getaway

reviews.text: I got a good deal on this hotel and I have no hesitation in recommending it to others.As other reviewers have said,it is very close to the Woodley Park Metro station and a few minutes walk from the Zoo.About 25 minutes walk through some very attractive suburbs brought us to Washington National Cathedral.
reviews.title: Overall good experience
Pretty Hotel
reviews.text: The Omni Hotel in D.C. is a pretty hotel. The lobby is large & gorgeous and the rooms a beautifully decorated.

reviews.title: Old fashioned hotel, ok service
reviews.text: It's location though is far from the main attractions.

reviews.title: Great old hotel with a only few rough edges
reviews.text: The cost of parking in D.C. is expensive, I would recommend staying in a hotel close to the attractions you would like to see because parking in the hotel is about $30 a night, and to park during the day by the main attractions is $25 a day or so.

We were also lost looking for the hotel as well. When we reserved this hotel we wanted something nice and were willing to pay the extra costs, we even requested the best view. Upon arrival they gave away our room because we were late due to being lost looking for the hotel, and they placed us in the lowest level of accommodations which was a disappointment. They didn't offer any upgrade or some type of compensation. There service wasn't kind.
reviews.title: Restful in spite of the crowds!

reviews.text: The hotel offers a kids program, which gives out a backpack of goodies and milk & cookies in the evening. The only thing they gave us was milk & cookies in the evening because they no longer had backpacks of goodies.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but had some issues!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights and had a great time in Washington. Room was spacious, yes air con is loud but didn't bother us as not middle of summer. Pool & sauna a welcome end to a busy day sightseeing. All staff very helpful.Odd smell from kitchens down below if window opened but not too problematic (or we would have asked to move).
reviews.title: Friendly hotel with plenty of facilities

reviews.text: Very busy with conferences but never had a problem with lifts & we were on 6th floor. Well worth signing up for Select Guest in advance as we got orange juice every morning & free internet, plus newspapers.
reviews.title: 3 Nights @ Omni Shoreham Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel is a tad out of the way but VERY close to Metro so easy to get around the city. However be careful on weekends & allow extra time as this is when they do track maintenance & often sharing of tracks, which means delays. We got caught out the 1 time we needed to be somewhere on time & got out at an earlier station than intended & got a taxi. Weekdays the system works very well but often no stations near to various sights so be ready for plenty of walking.
reviews.title: A hotel worth staying

reviews.text: High recommendation - Tim's walk the town tours - see separate tripadvisor reviews.
reviews.title: Great, just great!

reviews.text: Great hotel , very convenient for the Metro , 2 stops & you are on the Mall , plenty to see & do. Nearby are restaurants & a very good bar : Murphys . Hotel room very comfortable , secure. Nice gardens . Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Omni Shoreham is a lovely old hotel.

reviews.text: This hotel and Washington itself was an unexpected delight in our 2 week tour of New York and Maryland. We stayed for 2 nights in August but wish we had stayed longer. It was a very comfortable and elegant hotel. Our room was clean, large and quiet. The gardens were beautiful. We had a problem with the air conditioning but they fixed it without us asking. The hotel is very close to the subway and a quick 2 dollar ride into central Washington. It is also across the street from a variety restuarants and cafes. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had requested a corner room which ended up being a bad decision as the room was kind of gloomy, overlooking a parking lot. However, we were able to get a different room overlooking the pool and we really liked it, it was much brighter and seemed bigger even though it really was not. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - really enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: The Hotel is beautiful and everyone was helpful. We had planned to stay close to Dupont Circle and I was worried about the location, but we found it to be convenient. There were always cabs around and the Metro red line station was just about one block away.
reviews.title: Our DC Home-Away-From-Home

reviews.text: Unfortunately we did not get to enjoy the pool, the weather turned a little cold and we were too busy visiting DC, but the pool and the grounds are beautiful.
reviews.title: Beautiful classic

reviews.text: We signed up for the Select Guest membership and enjoyed the fresh coffee in the morning and free WiFi, curtesy of the Hotel.
reviews.title: Top-notch; superb in every regard
This grand old lady needs pest control!
reviews.text: I attended a conference that was housed at the Omni. The lobby and public areas are glorious. This hotel has a rich history, and I was thrilled to see the old photos and know its wonderful past. The rooms are a little shabby, but charming with little cubby rooms - I guess they used to be trunk rooms.

What wasn't charming was the mouse. I saw something dart across my room one evening, and I was sure that my eyes deceived me. But the next morning, the chocolate bar on my credenza was shredded and chewed, and I knew that I hadn't been dreaming. I asked the desk clerk - twice - for a humane mouse trap. It was my last day there, and I didn't want to be moved to another room. That night - late - after dinner, I got back to my room. No mouse trap. They hadn't gotten one, after I had called the front desk and the manager all day, and they assured me that they would dash up to the CVS and purchase one, if necessary.
reviews.title: Potentially a very good choice

reviews.text: They insisted on moving me. They sent a bellman and literally pulled the clothes out of the closet, repacked me and took me to the honeymoon suite. Fine - except for the bedbugs dancing in the jacuzzi tub! They then packed me up and took me to the Presidential Suite - larger than most homes. Full living room, dining room, kitchen, den, breakfast nook, bedroom, closets, bathroom with marble walk-in shower. Amazing. It was 11:30pm at that time, and I needed to be up around 5:30. I took a shower and fell into bed. I got up the next morning and watched the bugs strolling across the bathroom floor. I collected a bathroom glass full of their little bodies from around the baseboards and went to the front desk. (I found out later that they weren't bedbugs at all, but bugs found in older structures with a high population of mice. You think?!) The clerk assured me that they knew about the problem and had called the exterminators. I suggested that they start quickly. They offered me a complimentary stay, but I don't knowingly stay somewhere with this type of issue. I turned it down.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend the Omni Shoreham

reviews.text: Some common complaints that I heard from other attendees - and also experienced:
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: WiFi connections didn't happen, except in the lobby.
reviews.title: Could be better for the price
Motel 6 or Omni?
reviews.text: -Near metro

reviews.title: Wonderful place!
reviews.text: Awsome hotel and staff! Will go back to the Omni Shoreham again!

reviews.title: Absolutly Wonderful!
reviews.text: My friends and I went to Washington, DC for my 45th birthday last June 25th, 2005. When we arrived at the Omni Shoreham, we were given a suite! It was wonderful! So elegant and clean! We had a large bedroom with 2 queen beds, a huge living area with a door to a curved balcony. And off the living room was a adorable breakfast nook! The sofa and two chairs were so comfortable! The bathroom was small for the size of the suite, but all marble and very clean.

reviews.title: If you long for indifferent service, overbillings, and noise, stay here!
reviews.text: I had mentioned to the clerk who checked us in, that is was my birthday. She sent up a bottle of champagne and small box of chocolates! We came back from swimming in the beautiful pool to find that wonderful surprise! Never have I been treated so wonderfully by a hotel!

The hotel is just beautiful, and staff very friendly and accommodating. The pool area was comfortable and you even were able to get fresh fruit after a nice swim at the spa area. The towels and wash clothes are thick, soft and absorbent!
reviews.title: Fantastic historic hotel....

reviews.text: We recommended this hotel to a friend who went in August and was treated just as Royally. Over all, I will definitely go back to the Omni Shoreham! Loved the location also! Right near the Metro trains and the National Zoo is close by. Tons of restaurants right around the corner! Thanks to all who made my 45th birthday one I'll never forget!
reviews.title: Lovely time - get a grip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel if you are looking to enter a world of elegance very reminiscent of the Titanic. Not a good choice for people who like more modern spaces. There was also a cute coffee shop on the ground floor. Other note: front desk service was very slow, both when we checked-in and out.
reviews.title: Transport Back in Time

reviews.text: Our family of 4 stayed at the end of August 2011. Staff was all so friendly and pleasant. We had a few minor maintenance issues and the staff responded immediately. A/C is loud as others have reported but did not bother us as we are sound sleepers. I signed up for the hotel select guest program (free) and we got free internet in the room and 2 morning beverages each day brought to the room. Kids received milk and cookies first night there which they thought was pretty cool! The hotel and grounds are beautiful - kids really enjoyed the pool. Fitness room looked good but we did not use it. Our room was huge and had a walk in closet! A bit outdated but the hotel is old and so well maintained considering that! Very convenient to the Metro and Zoo. We ate at Open City and Woodley Cafe within a couple minutes walk. We didn't think either place was superb but service was good and food was fine. I would stay at this hotel again!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: There cannot possibly be a better hotel in DC for a family stay. My wife, daughter, and I visit frequently, and are treated like family by the mostly long-term employees. Ask for Tommy in the dining room, who is so friendly to your young ones that he makes the visit worth it all by himself. The pool and -- not kidding -- world class annuals garden (especially at tulip time) are unmatched in the city. There is a pool grill that serves Hawaiian specialties between Memorial and Labor Days, and is better than almost any country club grill. Borders on a resort feel in the summer. No reason to stay in the hot downtown with the kids when you can stay on the metro for 5 more minutes and say here for less. Edwardo runs a spotless and efficient health club. Rooms are huge. Upgrades to a larger size make you feel like you are staying with your rich cousins. Near the free zoo and metro. Huge inviting lobby your kids will love zooming through, and the other people are charmed. Makes you feel like summer in he middle of a blizzard with its decor. Tommy decorates the entire place with huge, over-the-top holiday decorations. Easy special enterance to the Marriott Wardman convention hotel, so there is no need to stay in that confusing overpriced place. The reason there are almost no complaints about people getting bad rooms is that Cristabel just keeps them all all straight.
reviews.title: Perfect for Famlies

reviews.text: My family of 4 stayed here at the end of August 2011 for 5 days, so that we could see Washington DC. Location is excellent - right next to everything and the subway is just steps away. Many restaurants closeby. Hotel is old but renovated and well maintained. We had a large room with 2 queen beds. Rooms were very spacious but the bathroom was small and toiletries were long overdue for an update. Toilet paper, shampoo and lotions are of low quality. The original air condition units seemed to have died a long time ago and the hotel simply put a big noisy unit next to the old one. The is actually the biggest problem with the room - the noisy a/c! Had trouble hearing the TV when it was on and could not sleep properly when it switched on. Not sure why they skimped on a/c when the hotel is so beautiful. We also had a few mosquitoes in the room that bit the kids quite badly. It was hard to catch them. Otherwise we quite enjoyed the room. The buffet breakfast was a bit pricey, but excellent. Room service was vey good as well. Liked the outdoor pool. Parking was $33 per night and wi-fi was not free in the room (9.95/night), but was free in the lobby. All in all, a very pleasant stay and the staff was great, except for one of the concierge guys...who was not very friendly. I would stay here again though. We paid $89 a night on Priceline...good value I would say.
reviews.title: Good Value
Nice hotel, but staff needs to learn manners
reviews.text: I was staying in this hotel for 1 night free of charge in room 740, the Bridal Suite, to make up for a bad experience at another Omni location earlier this year. The Suite was very spacious and had a great view of the garden from the terrace. The room was very clean and nicely laid out. The TV could definitely be bigger for such a large room, but not a big deal. The bathroom was also very clean and the shower/tub area was very spacious. We definitely loved the room.

The room was a good size for a solo business traveler; might have been tight for more guests. The bathroom was recently redone and sparkled. I was surprised to not have a desk, especially in today's laptop world. My other one room complaint was the constant dampness around the A/C ... no fun to go barefoot.
reviews.title: Great time at the OMNI
Great hotel; ptomaine trap restaurant
reviews.text: I was delighted to see soymilk on the room service offerings. This is the first time I've seen this on a chain hotel menu. Bravo!

reviews.title: Impressed
reviews.text: The hotel location was super. Walking distance to Adams Morgan and Dupont Circle.

reviews.title: 3rd visit and not the last
reviews.text: Worth checking out!

My son and I stayed at the Omni Shoreham for two nights in August. The room I had requested was ready upon my arrival,it was roomy and clean. The fornt desk receptionist was very friendly and courteous. Metro train station is only two blocks away from the hotel,and plenty of restaurants to choose from within the vincinity of the Omni.The parking fee at the hotel (self parking $22.00Per Day) is what I had expected. Overall this is a excellent hotel for a short weekend stay. P.S.My son misplaced his toy in our room(a stuffed parrot,traveled with us on all our vacations),it holds a lot of sentimental values.when we contacted the Omni hotel,the representative at the Omni was very courteous and promised us if the parrot was found,they will mail to us within couple of days. I was genuinely suprised we actually received the parrot within a week after the call was made. I will definitely return to this hotel in the near future.
reviews.title: excellent hotel
o.k. but probably wouldn't stay again
reviews.text: We got the Omni for $100. per night. I'm glad we only spend one night there. There were ants in the bathroom, blood on the bedskirt, and a dirty sock under the bedskirt.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, but Pricey!
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very friendly, but nothing was taken off of the bill when the problems were reported. We had no problem with the air cond. as others have reported here.
Parking is $22.00 a day - much more than hotels that are closer to town.
reviews.title: Moldy Carpet a Big Drawback
Bring your own pillow
reviews.text: The zoo is pretty far and uphill from the hotel.

This was our 3rd visit to the Omni having previously visited in 1999 and 2000 and found the hotel as good as ever. The concierge and reception desks were very professional and helpful though there seemed to be some conflict as to the value of travellers cheques they could cash on a daily basis ranging from $50-200. The in house shop had salads, hot coffees, fruit and sweets available throughout the day and the gift shop opened till late in the evening for papers and cards. We made use of a hire car in the second week and found the valet parking very good but expensive at $26 per night. Our bedroom was on the 6th floor and overlooked the rear garden where we witnessed several weddings throughout our 2 week stay. Our room was pretty clean albeit the carpet showed some staining. The en suite was very clean and the room attendant changed the linen including bed sheets daily as well as replenishing toilet rolls, shampoo etc. We made use of the Select Guest option which we joined on line prior to the holiday and this provided us with free morning beverages and a newspaper delivered to the bedroom at a time of our choice every morning. All in all the hotel was very clean with friendly attentive staff and on any future visits to Washington DC we will return to the Omni which we consider value for money.
reviews.title: Great for the price

reviews.text: We got a great deal on such a nice historic hotel, so we went for it. My wife, myself and another couple stayed here over the 4th of July weekend to enjoy the holiday festivities and we really enjoyed it. The hotel's lobby was beautiful with yellow roses everywhere and crystal chandeliers brightening every room. We were graciously checked in by BJ late at night and he put us in some huge rooms on the 4th floor. The rooms were spacious and every amenity was there, including complimentary water upon arrival and drinks every morning waiting at the doorstep.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Overall...Concierge, needs some help!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights and each day the service throughout the hotel staff was wonderful, minus the concierge. We called multiple times for everyday requests, including calling for a taxi, printing of boarding passes, and even food accommodations nearby or even in the hotel. They were always short with us and continued to offer ways we could do everything ourselves. I was under the impression the concierge desk was to help in the areas we were lacking knowledge...but not in this case. But I don't want to focus on this blemish. The rest of the hotel was very nice. The pool was nice, could use some deeper ends of the pool, or maybe a bit larger pool/spa area in the future. The metro was very accessible and right next to a McDonald's and CVS Pharmacy for some quick easy food or bottled water. Management was always visible and always greeting us upon departure or arrival and doormen/valet were very helpful in local hints on transportation/food.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation facilities and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would put this hotel on any top-list of hotels to frequent, especially at the rate that we got. We have no problems staying here the next time we are in town.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, needs more elevators

reviews.text: Omni Shoreham provides an excellent level of accommodation and service. The front desk is well organised, a welcome e mail with hints and tips was sent prior to arrival.Upon arrival we were obviously expected and enjoyed a very swift painless check in procedure and were reminded of the benefits of their Select Guest programme. Do join this programme , its free , offers free internet access and daily delivery of free morning beverages,
reviews.title: great hotel, They just need to personalise your stay

reviews.text: The room ,a standard King size ,was extremely large , enjoyed excellent garden views and views toward the Washington monument. Standards of cleanliness and decor were excellent and we particularly enjoyed the 42 inch TV , the walk in wardrobe , fridge and refreshment facilities,
reviews.title: Loved the Omni Shoreham

reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni with my husband who was on a business trip. It was very conveniently located to a metro stop, a CVS, and a quaint little restaurant district. The hotel is very charming on the inside. The small elevators were a bit of a challenge with a conference taking place, and the in room wifi was disastrous as far as my husband was concerned. But we loved the free morning beverages and first night cookies that came as part of their frequent guest program. The wifi was also free with that program so maybe that explains the spotty service. Don't pay for it. We had a handicapped room so the size was very generous however the bathroom lacked counter space and we were constantly knocking things onto the floor. I did love the location and the feel of history connected with the Omni. Make sure to eat at Open City just across the street. Yum.
reviews.title: Charming And Comfortable

reviews.text: Myself and two friends stayed at the Omni Shoreham for 4 nights in early June on what was our first visit to Washington DC. The hotel is an older property but kept in excellent shape with lots of old world charm. Our room was spacious with a large closet and a beautifully renovated bathroom. We had a large flat screen television and free wireless internet (something that was included in our room rate as a member of the hotels frequent traveller program). There is a very nice swimming pool and outdoor area that is nicely landscaped. This property is not especially close to any of the major sights however it is not that far either. A metro stop is close by and if you have a car, everything the city has to offer is within easy reach. Room service for breakfast was surprisingly affordable and something we took advantage of each and every morning. Valet parking is the only option if you are bringing your vehicle. Overall great value. I would definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Elegant older hotel in great shape

reviews.text: Went for business and leisure. My conference was at the Marriott Hotel nearby and am glad I stayed at the Omni. The Omni has character and is a good value. The main restaurant was very good and pricey. Pool area was very nice; staff friendly. About a block from the Metro line and many restaurants nearby. The only negative was that I used Priceline so had to stay in a smoking room the first night because the hotel was full.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights at the Omni Shoreham for a work related vacation. The staff was very friendly and we were impressed with the food and room service. The spa was mediocre at best and very small. I would not spend another dollar there again. My girlfriend had what she called a "very strange experience" when she got a facial. The pool was nice and had good service for drinks and food. The elevators are very old and slow for such a big hotel. The rooms had great beds, but felt dated. Our first room was a regular room and our last 3 nights were in a suite. Neither had MP3/iPod adaptable players as stated on the website. I would recommend finding a better hotel for the price. Just my opinion.
reviews.title: Not bad, there have to be better hotels for the money in DC

reviews.text: I recently stayed for 2 weeknights. I was there on business but had plenty of time to relax too. Hotel is big and busy with meetings and tourists, as is to be expected in DC in the summer. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Room was king sized (817) with a view of Rock Creek Park if you looked straight out, but parking lot if you looked down (so dont look down). I liked that this room was tucked in a little seperate hall at the end of a hall, so very quiet! Room was spacious and clean. Hotel is definietly old but you can tell it has been recently updated. Dont judge it by the exterior, which is very blah, old apartment-building. Inside is like an old European hotel.
reviews.title: Old Reliable, Nicely Re-Done, Good Location, Awesome Pool

reviews.text: Stayed here for business at a corporate rate. The location was perfect for my meetings etc and very close to the metro station (subway). The cleanliness of the room could have been better - bathroom and linen were clean but there were crumbs all over the carpeting... not what you expect from such a hotel. Everything else was clean so i refrained form asking for a room change. Overall, i would stay here again for business becasue of the location but it would not be my first choice for a leisure trip.
reviews.title: ok, but room for improvement

reviews.text: Wonderful old-fashioned hotel with beautifully redone rooms, very nice cloverleaf pool/spa (with some shaded areas), hammocks on the lawn, and gardens. Half block from Metro, lots of restaurants a block away, 6 blocks to National Zoo. Beds are very comfortable, WiFi works fine (and is free with hotel frequent stayer membership). Lovely (and very good) restaurant off the lobby. Always lots of weddings to watch on the weekends. Very comfortable all the way around. I want to come back!
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: We recently had a great stay at the Omni Shoreham. There were 6 people in our group, using 3 rooms in total. The hotel was clean and pleasant and the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room, which was quite near the elevators, was quiet due to the room layout, which included a small hallway. Unfortunately we experienced a little of hurricane Irene during our stay and our room, which faced the rear of the hotel was fine, however both the couples with us had to move rooms due to leaking window frames from the constant rain at the front of the hotel. I am only mentioning this as when my parents had to move rooms, the member of staff who came to check out their complaint indicated that this has happened before as the windows in the hotel need repairing/changing. The hotel sent my parents a basket of fruit & cheese as an apology for the room change which was nice of them. However It is a shame that a lovely old hotel needs repairs that would appear not to be forthcoming.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and service

reviews.text: Having said that, this did not affect our stay, what I can say for certain is that there are many lovely rooms at the Shoreham!
reviews.title: Expensive nice hotel in DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the Omni for a meeting at a decent rate - wouldn't pay the regular rate.
reviews.title: Great hotel in general

reviews.text: Great experience! The location was close to the metro and reasonably priced restaurants. The beds were heavenly. I wish we had more time to enjoy the gorgeous pool and grounds. Fireflies abound in the evening and were a treat to watch. The Shoreham is a beautiful historic hotel that is so comfortable and elegant I would rate it 5 star!
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: We stayed at the Omni Shoreham with our two teen grandsons for four nights. We chose the Zoo package which was well worth the extra considering the appetites of two teens and the WONDERFUL breakfast buffet that was included in the deal as well as free valet parking. We used the metro, one block away, for our transportation so the car sat snugly in the lot until our departure. The metro ride to the monuments was about 20-- 30 minutes including a transfer at Metro City stop. We also rode the double decker tour bus which stopped one block from the hotel. Sitting on top was fun for all of us and the bus stopped at all of the popular sights including Arlington. The boys (as well as my husband and I) were very impressed with the elegance of the hotel, the pool, exercise room and the little amenities such as milk and cookies in room and plenty of linens, pillows, etc. It is a beautiful old hotel and the room was certainly clean and adequate though we noticed a couple of minor needed repairs (leaky tub faucet, wall trim end cap missing). The small refrigerator in our room was barely cool so our water bottles were not kept as cold as we would have liked. The service was great except when we were leaving and waited almost a half hour for our car to be brought up. Other than the "free" breakfast we found the prices in the restaurant to be prohibitive. However there were several reasonable neighborhood restaurants close by that offered a variety of decent ethnic as well as traditonal American food. There is even a Baskin-Robbins nearby!
reviews.title: Nice experience with only a few minor glitches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed 5 nights in early june 2010
reviews.title: we'd stay again, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bullet points
reviews.title: Beautiful room but with a noisy hallway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 min walk to metro giving swift access to the centre
reviews.title: I loved it here and so will you.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed in this hotel for three nights in the beginning of June. The hotel is huge and amazing! The lobby is very grand and spacious, staff is very friendly. The rooms are nice and clean and about average size and apparently well insolated. There was a large wedding party sleeping across the hall and we didn't hear a thing ( We were exhausted after the flight but still).
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have only eaten in the Marquee bar, so I can only comment on that but it was great. Very tasty and reasonably priced. For breakfast I recommend Open city across the street. You can sit outside or in and they have a great breakfast selection, catering to both american and european tastes. And you can choose healthier options, like fruit or tomatoes instead of hashbrowns. I have not tried the breakfast in the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel- Not happy With Service

reviews.text: Absolute highlight of the hotel is the Pool. It's gorgeous! You feel like you're in a resort. Because it is a rather expensive hotel (we had een good deal of about 500 dollars for three nights through expedia, but the normal rate is more than double) the pool is not crowded with people who hog all the chairs. And if you put up a little flag next to your chair, the waiter will come and help you, how cool is that!
reviews.title: Big, bustling, grand hotel; a little frayed, but good value

reviews.text: As for the location, in the surrounding area there is the zoo, a supermarket, the woodley park metro stop and several places to eat including aforementioned Open City and McDonalds. The National Mall is about 10 min Metro ride away, so perfectly acceptable.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next stop (2 min away) is Dupont Circle which has a lot of nice places to eat.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, nice rooms

description: Come home to the Omni Shoreham Hotel, a true Washington landmark. Located in one of the most sought after DC neighborhoods, this luxury property fuses modern comforts with distinguished service. This urban oasis is located on 11 plush acres just steps from the metro and the National Zoo. Sip a cocktail in the Marquee Bar or, during the warmer months, guests can lounge poolside at one of the "South's Best Pools" as rated by Southern Living Magazine.
